title: Amarasi - Mark (Print)
description:
This Amarasi Gospel of Mark tells the story of the life of Jesus. Amarasi is a minority language of West Timor.

Amarasi is a Central Malayo-Polynesian language of West Timor, and is spoken by the Amarasi. The Amarasi language has about 80,000 native speakers, with four main dialects called Ro'is, Kotos, Tais Nonof, and Ketun, though many differences exist between individual villages. It uses Subject-Object-Verb grammar structure. Speakers are interspersed with those of Helong.

language.name: Amarasi
language.location: Indonesia, Nusa Tenggara and Southwestern Maluku
language.area: Southwest tip, Timor Island. Kotos is central and east, Ro’is is west, Ro’is Tais Nonof is south, Ro’is Hero surrounded by Helong [heg]. 24 townships.
